nodes.name: rule
executeRuling

rule(uint256,uint256).details: Give a ruling for a dispute. Must be called by the arbitrator. The purpose of this function is to ensure that the address calling it has the right to rule on the contract.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute in the Arbitrator contract.
params._ruling: Ruling given by the arbitrator. Note that 0 is reserved for "Not able/wanting to make a decision".

devdoc.title: Arbitrable Arbitrable abstract contract. When developing arbitrable contracts, we need to: -Define the action taken when a ruling is received by the contract. We should do so in executeRuling. -Allow dispute creation. For this a function must:     -Call arbitrator.createDispute.value(_fee)(_choices,_extraData);     -Create the event Dispute(_arbitrator,_disputeID,_rulingOptions);
